channel.title: Is this even possible?
channel.description:
Is there a code so I can make it so you hit less often? Like a line?
Example:
if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 4718) //GreatAxe { (A code here that would make this player hit less often on other player (Player vs player) }
Is this even possible?
[font=Verdana]Edit; I simply wanna make it so when you equip this weapon, you hit less often. What code would I have to put. Without having to modify any bonuses. Would it be somthing with.....hitDiff = misc.random(40);??
I dont know. [/font]

item.title: Is this even possible?
item.dc:creator: @parkview parkview
item.description:
@parkview wrote:

I tried this but no reaction. Thanks for the help though.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this even possible?
item.dc:creator: @Envion Envion
item.description:
@Envion wrote:

I haven’t browsed the sources in a long time and I’m really not interested in downloading one just to pick through it and complete an easy task for you.

Do a little looking. Find where the attack routine is located; where we determine the target, what damage is being dealt to it, any effects that are being applied, etc. In there would be an equation factoring in the player’s Attack skill (for chance to miss reduction) and Strength skill (for higher possible upper-bound on damage). All you need to do is add a conditional statement that makes a miss more likely (perhaps Attack*0.5 to make a miss twice as likely) when the conditions I mentioned previously are met.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this even possible?
item.dc:creator: @Envion Envion
item.description:
@Envion wrote:

You would need to implement a check in the attack routine.

Modify the hit equation to make a miss more likely if weapon = true and target = player.

item.title: Is this even possible?
item.dc:creator: @fadsfsads fadsfsads
item.description:
@fadsfsads wrote:

try item.cfg. I’m not sure if this answers your question, but in item.cfg go down to 859 and edit the stat bonuses. The only setback is that you hit less on both player and npc.

Read full topic
